title: Piz Umbrail
text:
Piz Umbrail (3,033 m) is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> of the <a href="Ortler%20Alps">Ortler Alps</a>, south of the <a href="Umbrail%20Pass">Umbrail Pass</a> (2,503 m), located on the border between <a href="Lombardy">Lombardy</a> (<a href="Italy">Italy</a>) and <a href="Graub%C3%BCnden">Graubünden</a> (<a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a>).
The mountain surface is partly of rubble and partly covered by grass, and therefore of little interest to mountaineers, but its proximity to the <a href="Umbrail%20Pass">Umbrail Pass</a> and accessible surface make it a popular destination for other visitors. In winter it is a relatively easy destination for ski-mountaineers.
Normal route to the summit.
The route starts at the <a href="Umbrail%20pass">Umbrail pass</a>, very close to the Swiss border check point. There is a lot of free parking space around. You will need up to 90 minutes from there to the summit. No special equipment is needed, there are a few fixed chains along the route but those are not exposed sections, good marking all the time, and orientation is not a problem.
Access roads.
There are three roads to the Umbrail pass; two from the Italian and one from the Swiss side. From Italy you have a south road from Bormio, and the road from the north-east which goes over the nearby <a href="Stelvio%20pass">Stelvio pass</a>. From the Swiss side you have a road from the <a href="Val%20M%C3%BCstair">Val Müstair</a>.
